DOC.detailed_description: Background : Previous research show oxidize property microbiological efficacy chlorine dioxide ( ClO2 ) . Its clinical efficacy oral malodor evaluate report , however , clinical study investigate microbiological efficacy periodontal malodorous bacteria . The aim study assess inhibitory effect mouthwash contain ClO2 morning oral malodor salivary periodontal malodorous bacteria use 7 day . Methods : A randomized , double blind , crossover , placebo-controlled clinical trial conduct among 15 healthy male volunteer , divide 2 group . In first test phase , group 1 subject ( N = 8 ) instruct rinse experimental mouthwash contain ClO2 twice per day 7 day , group 2 ( N = 7 ) rinse control ( placebo ) mouthwash without ClO2 . In second test , phase one week washout period , group use opposite mouthwash 7 day . At baseline 7 day , oral malodor evaluate OM , concentration hydrogen sulfide ( H2S ) , methyl mercaptan ( CH3SH ) dimethyl sulfide ( ( CH3 ) 2S ) , main VSCs human oral malodor , evaluate GC .
